phrases: What am I going to do with you?
Or I am going to step out on you!
Hiro-chan, did you have another fight with your husband?
If he apologizes, we are done for good.
Or I am going to step out on you!
How can you play the piano?
Why would not I be able to play the piano?
Let us turn Kousei into a pianist!
What are you going to play?
I am not changing the song.
It is not music or anything at all!
So I am going to prove it.
Just how great a musician Kaori Miyazono is.
This is a supreme directive from the shrew.
These galas are all about standing out.
Wait, this is a violin concert, right?
Is that accompanist going to play on his own?
Because you put me back on the stage.
I am going to prove it.
That Kaori Miyazono, who is named me to be her accompanist...
Kreisler... Love's Sorrow... Rachmaninoff's Piano Arrangement.
So you have been facing it alone all this time.
Is this the Love's Sorrow that you have always known?
I am incredible... Kaori Miyazono is...
He is only venting his anger.
He is confusing crudeness with ferocity.
Was I pounding the keys that hard?
This will not do at all.
This is not how you play it, right?
The song that I always listened to was...
Even though I cannot hear the notes as usual,
I can hear the sound inside me.
I think it means that you are not bound by sounds.
Was not there ever a moment
when you sensed the notes suffused with your desires and emotions?
Losing the ability to hear the notes...
I am sure that that is... a gift.
Like you are caressing a baby's head.
Play it like you are embracing him.
would she have played it like this?
Even for you, that is going too far!
Hitting him hard enough to draw blood - that is way too harsh!
Kousei was doing his best just to make you happy!
I am... running out of time.
I am the one who drove you into this corner.
It is all because I told her to turn you into a pianist.
If music only brings Kousei pain and suffering...
Then I have no business being by his side.
I am sorry... I am sorry...
What made you turn to the piano?
I want to see that sight again with my own eyes one more time.
That is what made me think...
That I would like become a really weird pianist!
If Kousei believes in that, then as a pianist,
how can I not believe in the power of music?
is about to bid you a last farewell.
I cannot help thinking about her, after all.
This song has my mother's scent.
Who are you going to play it for?
What is going to become of Kousei?
Will be able to earn a living?
Can he make music his livelihood?
All I can do right now is make him play accurately, faithful to the score.
As long as he has the skills, he just might be able to support himself someday.
There is nothing I can leave that boy...
Will he brush his teeth every morning?
He falls asleep anywhere, so what if he catches a cold?
He is not good at sports, so what if he gets seriously injured?
I wish I could have stayed with him longer...
Will my treasure... ever find happiness?
The ghost of my mother was a shadow of my own creation.
An excuse for me to run away.
There is both Love's Joy and Love's Sorrow, so why...
Just like the notes are intermittently connected...
It is shared by us all.
with the people you do not know,
with all the people in the world.
Just like with her, I am connected to Mom, too.
I am moving forward because I believe that.
Hey, look at you, hot stuff!
If my husband hears that his daughter threw herself into a man's arms,
So did you get to see Saki?
She is always been by my side.
The way I touch the keys, the way I move my fingers, my habit of squeezing the pedals,
my tastes, the order that I eat...
Mom's in every little gesture of mine.
Do you think it reached my mom?
The way I played my very best...
Do you think it reached Mom?
You two are connected, are not you?
Because of music, I was given the chance to meet others.
I was moved by those encounters.
There are people that I got to meet.
I am ready to just go home now!
I do not want to hear anything right now.
I never thought I would be so scared to go onstage.
Now this is a tough act to follow...
Would I have played my heart out like he did?
Would I have played with as much sincerity as he did?
I want to see if I can sacrifice body and soul like that.
Right now, all I want to do is hear my mom's voice.
Is his playing softer than usual?
So your heart's been pierced, too?
And you are both going to raise the bar, eh?
I am glad that I am a musician.
Now that is the ultimate pleasure...
I cannot find the words to say...
Was it okay for you to just leave?
I was just a throw-in for the throw-in.
I have got to find that throw-in who blew me off, and rip her a new one.
All right, ready to head home?
I am exhausted from all this.
Hey, your mom could go for some, too.
You have got nothing to say to me after all my hard work?
I was hoping you would praise me.
If I do not hold them in, I might she would tears.
Tears of relief because I was able to talk to Kousei normally?
Or because I was able to talk to him normally...
If you were there at the concert,
you could have said something to me.
You are as spiteful as ever, are not you?
To think that Arima-kun was being mentored by you...
After all, ever since Saki Arima passed away, you never went near that house.
He is become quite an intriguing musician.
leaving something in those who hear it.
That kid has taken his first steps forward as an artist.
was tragic for Kousei, and for me,
but was it really necessary for Kousei Arima, the musician?
There is an ever-present sorrow hanging over Arima-kun's music.
If the death of his beloved mother
Then it is a demon's path that he must walk.
His growth is spurred by sorrow...
If Kousei is to walk that path,
he might have to lose someone to move forward.
